column1: # ONLY EMPIRICAL PARAMETERS that need calibration are included here.
# should be set in biogeo_params.txt or forcing files
#   - Parameters: GHG yields and benthic fluxes (empirical
# Goal: Achieve 40-60 km salt intrusion in dry season (March 2025 validation)
# 1. LC (Convergence Length) - Controls exponential width decay W(x) = W0*exp(-x/a)
#    Shorter LC → faster convergence → different intrusion dynamics
#    MUST CALIBRATE for each ocean-connected branch
# 2. VDB_K - Van den Burgh K coefficient: Controls dispersion decay
#    Higher K → shorter intrusion (faster dispersion decay)
# 3. D0 - Dispersion at mouth: Direct control of salt transport magnitude
# Convergence length [m] - CALIBRATED from Stage 1 optimization
# Best RMSE = 9.21 achieved with these values
# Van den Burgh K coefficient - CALIBRATED
# Settling velocity [m/s] - depends on grain size distribution (empirical)
# CRITICAL FIX: Increased MERO range 100x to enable actual erosion
# Lower TauEro to allow erosion at typical estuarine velocities
# PAC = P adsorption capacity [µmol P / mg SPM]

column2: atmospheric pCO2 are MEASURED data - set in biogeo_params.txt

column1: # Only EMPIRICAL parameters that cannot be directly measured are here.
# N2O yields from nitrification and denitrification (empirical)
# Mekong has high CH4 due to rice paddies and organic-rich sediments
# NOTE: Current_K (gas exchange) is NOT included in Stage 4 because it
# affects O2 exchange which was calibrated in Stage 3. Including it here
# would degrade O2 accuracy while trying to fit GHG targets.

column2: move Current_K to Stage 3 with O2 targets.
